data.title: Tom Hanks
data.meta_description: After becoming the first person in Hollywood to publicly disclose contracting COVID-19 in 2020 alongside his wife Rita Wilson, Hanks had a productive 2021 as the industry slowly bounced back from shutdown. data.text:
After becoming the first person in Hollywood to publicly disclose contracting COVID-19 in 2020 alongside his wife Rita Wilson, Hanks had a productive 2021 as the industry slowly bounced back from shutdown. As one of the fundraising chairs for the Academy Museum, Hanks helped preside over its widely well-received and long-delayed debut. His partnership with Apple continued with November’s sci-fi drama “Finch” and his upcoming WWII series “Masters of the Air” with fellow executive producer Steven Spielberg. And he set himself up for a big 2022, shooting Disney’s live-action “Pinocchio” with longtime collaborator Robert Zemeckis, hopping aboard Wes Anderson’s next film “Asteroid City” and finally wrapping production on Baz Luhrmann’s long-awaited Elvis biopic, where he plays Colonel Tom Parker.

Sony Pictures has released the trailer for Robert Zemeckis' "Here," which is the sixth collaboration between the "Forrest Gump" director and his leading man Tom Hanks. Based on the graphic novel by Richard McGuire, "Here" tells the century-long story of a single house and all the different people who lived there. The camera sits at a fixed angle for the entire 104-minute duration without moving. In another "Forrest Gump" reunion, the film's main couple is played by Hanks and Robin...
